article.headline: E. Michigan 55, Ball St. 53
article.story: MUNCIE, Ind. -- Brandon Bowdry scored six of his team-high 13 points in overtime and had 11 rebounds to lead Eastern Michigan to a 55-53 victory over Ball State on Sunday. Justin Dobbins added 11 points and Antonio Green had 10 for Eastern (8-23, 6-10 Mid-American Conference). Rob Giles led Ball State (13-16, 7-9) with 18 points and 14 rebounds, and Laron Frazier had 10 points. Bowdry hit two free throws 15 minutes into overtime to give the Eagles a 43-41 lead that they never surrendered, and his jump shot made it 53-46 with 1:44 remaining. Ball State scored six of the next seven points on a basket by Malik Perry, two free throws by Giles and a Frazier 3-pointer that made it 54-53 with 23 seconds left, but came no closer. Ball State finished tied for first place in the MAC's West Division and claimed the second seed in the MAC Tournament.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
